definition: great sage/mahatma/king/emperor/outstanding personage/Buddha
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
holy/sacred/saint/sage
Great-Sage Sun/Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1]
Great Sage the Equal of Heaven, self-proclaimed title of the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]

sentences.english: Thus the Great Sage was caught.
Besides, ideas on the development of Monkey King culture and the cultural industry in Shunchang are put forward hereafter.
sentences.chinese: 在此基础上，对大圣文化与顺昌文化产业提出了思考。

sentences.english: He is Sun Wukong, the Great Sage Equaling Heaven, who made havoc in Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 就是那大闹天宫的齐天大圣孙悟空。

sentences.english: The Daishonin was fiercely attacked by people throughout Japan.
sentences.chinese: 大圣人曾遭受日本全国猛烈的反弹攻击。

sentences.english: A gilded Monkey enshrined in his "Great Sage" temple.
sentences.chinese: 大圣庙坛中的老孙金身。

sentences.english: Wu-k'ung dived into a brook and changed into a fish.
sentences.chinese: 那大圣又将身按下，钻进溪流里变作一条鱼儿。

sentences.english: This place contains one of the greatest of the twenty-five sacred places in Khampa areas.
sentences.chinese: 这里有康巴藏区二十五大圣地之王的章龙贝玛喜布。

definition: (honorific appellation of a deity)
Great Sage the Equal of Heaven, self-proclaimed title of the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
great immortal
God of heaven/Celestial emperor
Jade Emperor (in Taoism)
Dragon King (mythology)
Gyuumao
Temple in Heaven (e.g. of the Jade Emperor)
Great-Sage Sun/Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1]
Buddha/founder of a buddhist sect
Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
kun 鯤|鲲[kun1] and peng 鵬|鹏[Peng2], mythological beasts/peng, a gigantic bird transformed from the kun
Laozi or Lao-tze (c. 500 BC), Chinese philosopher, the founder of Taoism/the sacred book of Daoism, 道德經|道德经 by Laozi
clear sky
the most honorable/the most respected/supreme/(archaic) the emperor
tathagata (Buddha's name for himself, having many layers of meaning - Sanskrit: thus gone, having been Brahman, gone to the absolute etc)
